title: [pigeon] Generate C++ structs in .h files
body:
### Use case

Currently `pigeon` has a `@SwiftClass` annotation to allow choice between struct and class for data classes.

Since Flutter encourages a Data class pattern, it would be good to be able to make a similar choice between struct/class in C++ as well.

### Proposal

I would like to propose an annotation and/or option in `cppOptions` to generate C++ `struct` code as opposed to a class in header files.

It could be a `@CppStruct` annotation, or - (while a breaking change), `@SwiftClass` could be renamed to `@DataClass`, and controlling this behavior for both Swift and C++.

body:
We should ensure that Flutter apps are valid for the App Store. There's certain setups that we should validate 

* Default Flutter app
* Add to app
* Extensions (see https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/142531)
* SwiftPM
* Privacy Manifests


There's an Xcode command line tool called `altool` that would allow us to do this.

```
xcrun altool --validate-app -f /path/to/my/app.ipa --type ios -u apple_account@email.com -p @keychain:ALTOOL_PASSWORD
```

How to generate password: https://support.apple.com/en-us/102654

labels.description: Accessibility, e.g. VoiceOver or TalkBack. (aka a11y)

body:
Due to this [Android deprecation](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/View#announceForAccessibility(java.lang.CharSequence)) Flutter needs to show deprecation warnings to developers when using announce on Android.

Unfortunately testing this log statement is impossible since robolectric currently does not support API >=36.
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/165220 will add the test code in once robolectric supports 36.

title: [Proposal] Add `forceErrorText` to DropdownButtonFormField

labels.name: c: new feature
labels.description: Nothing broken; request for a new capability

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: material design
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter/material repository.

labels.name: c: proposal
labels.description: A detailed proposal for a change to Flutter

labels.name: team-framework
labels.description: Owned by Framework team

body:
### Use case

Currently, the DropdownButtonFormField widget does not provide a built-in mechanism to force the display of an error message. This limitation can restrict developers when they need to customize form validation behaviors and ensure that error messages are displayed under specific conditionsregardless of the default validation flow. By exposing a forceErrorText parameter in the widget's constructor, developers will gain finer control over the error display, which is especially useful in complex forms requiring custom validation logic.



### Proposal

Introduce a new forceErrorText parameter in the DropdownButtonFormField constructor. This parameter should be forwarded to the FormField superclass by calling super.forceErrorText during initialization. This enhancement will enable developers to explicitly control when error messages are rendered, thereby improving the flexibility and usability of form validations in Flutter applications while maintaining backward compatibility with existing implementations.

title: iOS excessive GPU memory usage
body:
### Steps to reproduce

Latest Flutter, creates several big textures and large buffers which were not created by a year old engine.
1. I used latest stable and 3.30.0-1.0.pre.603

title: [a11y] TalkBack/Screenreader navigates to the previous screen when 'tapping' on PopupMenuItem

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team

body:
### Steps to reproduce

It seems like there is an issue with the combination of PopupMenuItem and TalkBack/screenreader. When TalkBack/Screenreader is enabled and you 'tap' on the PopupMenuItem, the handleTap is executed, which leads to navigation to the previous page. This does not happen without TalkBack/screenreader, which executes the OnTap within the PopupMenuItem.

### Expected results

While using TalkBack/Screenreader, tapping on the PopupMenuItem should execute the OnTap function.

### Actual results

While using TalkBack/Screenreader, tapping on the PopupMenuItem leads to the previous page.

### Code sample

<details open><summary>Code sample</summary>

```dart
  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return BlocConsumer<FilePickerCubit, FilePickerState>(
        bloc: _cubit,
        listener: _listen,
        builder: (BuildContext context, FilePickerState state) {
          if (state is FilePickerReadyState) {
            return PopupMenuItem<dynamic>(
              child: Semantics(
                label: widget.errorText,
                child: ActionTile(
                  title: _localization.fileSourceNewPhoto,
                  onTap: () {
                    _cubit.pickFromCamera(showTips: widget.showCameraTips);
                  },
                ),
              ),
            );
          }
        });
  }

```
In PopupMenuEntry:
```dart

@protected
void handleTap() {
  // Need to pop the navigator first in case onTap may push new route onto navigator.
  Navigator.pop<T>(context, widget.value);

  widget.onTap?.call();
}
```

</details>

body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone the example project at https://github.com/kekland/fragment_shader_bug, and launch on iOS. For comparison, you can also launch the same project on macOS, where no bug seems to be present.
2. By default, three containers are visible (`simple.frag`, `texture.frag`, `texture.frag` using AnimatedSampler from `flutter_shaders`). The result should be three proper gradients
3. Click on the "1" on the bottom to disable the first container. This will result in the other two containers somehow changing their UVs.

### Expected results

The other containers should not be affected by the first container.

### Actual results

The other containers seem to not be binding their uniforms - if I set the fragment color to `vec4(u_size, 0.0, 1.0)`, then the color is black. Somehow this is not present when there's no `sampler2D`. 

On macOS everything seems to work well.

title: ListView.builder, GridView.builder, PageView.builder - incorrect context
Fix arrowHeadColor breaks differentiation between states

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: material design
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter/material repository.

body:
Fix https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/160458

The arrowheads color is currently displayed wrong when passing `arrowHeadColor` parameter, it's due to the `arrowHeadColor` is passing to IconButton.icon widget, not IconButton.color itself. Meanwhile, the IconButton state depends on `onPressed` callback and the button color logic happens in IconButton, not in Icon widget. The fix is simply to pass `arrowHeadColor` to IconButton so that buttons will be displaying correct color when state changes.

| before | after |
| --------------- | --------------- |
<video src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20f08366-7c42-4f00-bfea-40f1c6498dd7"/> | <video src="https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a018a60f-4238-4f8a-9784-1db71592f08c"/>

labels.name: in triage
labels.description: Presently being triaged by the triage team

body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. When I open the keyboard on one page, it will trigger the rebuild of components on other pages, resulting in frame dropping. How can I avoid triggering the rebuild of other pages?
2. Since invoking the keyboard will affect the size of the current window, I found that components involving MediaQuery in the possible components will all be rebuilt (components such as Scaffold, TabBar, ListView, etc.). How can I make invoking the keyboard on the current page not affect the rebuild of other pages? 
3. I have set resizeToAvoidBottomInset to false.
